### Exercise 1

#### Import CSV

Set working directory: We are not going to do it

Importing the CSV database under the name of Q1_B, with "," as separator, and with "." as decimal:



::: {.cell hash='Data-Analysis-Wk1_cache/pdf/unnamed-chunk-1_fd2be0e818d6641af4d4ce19d5252864'}

```{.r .cell-code .numberLines}
Q1_B <- read.csv("C:/Users/pined/OneDrive - Universidad Nacional Mayor de San Marcos/Javier 2022/Belgica/AC2_DataAnalysis_ThWk/Material/Q1_B.csv", sep=",", dec= ".")
```
:::



#### Subset by row

Seeing FSN


::: {.cell hash='Data-Analysis-Wk1_cache/pdf/unnamed-chunk-2_6f4a8c30cf11a12bf257d84a917b1d3a'}

```{.r .cell-code .numberLines}
summary(Q1_B$FSN)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
   Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
  45001   48527   52032   52110   55671   59606 
```
:::
:::


::: callout-tip
The median is 52032
::: 

Creating subset


::: {.cell hash='Data-Analysis-Wk1_cache/pdf/unnamed-chunk-3_60c682c3f96703d4e9276ed90354fc41'}

```{.r .cell-code .numberLines}
top <- subset(Q1_B, subset= FSN < 52032)
bottom <- subset(Q1_B, subset= FSN >= 52032)
```
:::



Seeing the structure in all sets


::: {.cell hash='Data-Analysis-Wk1_cache/pdf/unnamed-chunk-4_8b7bffb130f98a54386fcd1400729ab2'}

```{.r .cell-code .numberLines}
str(Q1_B)
```

#### Joining (Merge)
Join database by ID


::: {.cell hash='Data-Analysis-Wk1_cache/pdf/unnamed-chunk-9_1c949ab3cfb0befebc4e4cb0ef584d5b'}

```{.r .cell-code .numberLines}
merged_left_right  <-  merge(Left, Rigth, all=TRUE, by = "FSN")
str(merged_left_right)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

#### Renaming variables

Renaming variables labels: In collumns 2-5 to "anim", "count", "dist", "indor", "daysin"


::: {.cell hash='Data-Analysis-Wk1_cache/pdf/unnamed-chunk-12_21945023eff0d8c99fb116efbf705949'}

```{.r .cell-code .numberLines}
names(Q1_B_1)[c(2,3,4,5,6)] <- c("anim", "count", "dist", "indor", "daysin")
str(Q1_B_1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
'data.frame':	9029 obs. of  6 variables:
 $ FSN   : int  45001 45001 45002 45003 45004 45006 45009 45021 45021 45024 ...
 $ anim  : chr  "Goats" "Poultry (chickens, ducks, pigeon)" "Buffaloes" "Cows/Oxen" ...
 $ count : int  3 1 1 1 2 2 7 3 1 3 ...
 $ dist  : int  5 0 4 3 5 0 0 15 5 15 ...
 $ indor : int  1 1 0 1 1 1 1 0 1 1 ...

```
:::

#### Renaming observations



::: {.cell hash='Data-Analysis-Wk1_cache/pdf/unnamed-chunk-13_0980db66fa64423ceb58b8bd5b998a38'}

```{.r .cell-code .numberLines}
table(Q1_B_1$anim)
```

```

                        Buffaloes                         Cows/Oxen 
                             1592                              3055 
                             Dogs                             Goats 
                               38                              3816 
                            Other                              Pigs 
                                3                                20 
Poultry (chickens, ducks, pigeon) 
                              505 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code .numberLines}
Q1_B_1$anim[Q1_B_1$anim =="Buffaloes"] <- "Buff"
Q1_B_1$anim[Q1_B_1$anim =="Goats"] <- "Goat"

#But if we want to keep the 4 (x) first characters in a all rows
Q1_B_1$anim <- substr(Q1_B_1$anim, 0, 4)
table(Q1_B_1$anim)
```

```
'data.frame':	9029 obs. of  6 variables:

 $ anim  : chr  "Goat" "Poul" "Buff" "Cows" ...
 $ count : int  3 1 1 1 2 2 7 3 1 3 ...
 $ dist  : int  5 0 4 3 5 0 0 15 5 15 ...

 $ daysin: int  120 365 -1 210 180 360 360 -1 150 90 ...
```

:::
:::



#### Long to Wide

We need one line for each household

So, we will use reshape command to say: Reshape the database taking in to account that i want to make the database wider, having just one line for household (FSN) and replicating the variables count, dist, indor, daysin for every animal that the household had.



::: {.cell hash='Data-Analysis-Wk1_cache/pdf/unnamed-chunk-14_ee399caf31c0443c05c33bb47313fcf1'}

```{.r .cell-code .numberLines}
Newtable <- reshape(Q1_B_1,direction = "wide", timevar ="anim", idvar ="FSN", v.names = c("count","dist","indor", "daysin"), sep = "_")
str(Newtable)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
'data.frame':	7147 obs. of  29 variables:
 $ FSN        : int  45001 45002 45003 45004 45006 45009 45021 45024 45025 45027 ...
 $ count_Goat : int  3 NA NA 2 NA 7 1 3 3 NA ...
 $ dist_Goat  : int  5 NA NA 5 NA 0 5 15 0 NA ...
 $ indor_Goat : int  1 NA NA 1 NA 1 1 1 1 NA ...
 $ daysin_Goat: int  120 NA NA 180 NA 360 150 90 90 NA ...
 $ count_Poul : int  1 NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA 2 ...
 $ dist_Poul  : int  0 NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA 0 ...
 $ indor_Poul : int  1 NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA 1 ...
 $ daysin_Poul: int  365 NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA 360 ...
 $ count_Buff : int  NA 1 NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ dist_Buff  : int  NA 4 NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ indor_Buff : int  NA 0 NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ daysin_Buff: int  NA -1 NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ count_Cows : int  NA NA 1 NA 2 NA 3 NA NA NA ...
 $ dist_Cows  : int  NA NA 3 NA 0 NA 15 NA NA NA ...
 $ indor_Cows : int  NA NA 1 NA 1 NA 0 NA NA NA ...
 $ daysin_Cows: int  NA NA 210 NA 360 NA -1 NA NA NA ...
 $ count_Pigs : int  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ dist_Pigs  : int  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ indor_Pigs : int  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ daysin_Pigs: int  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ count_Dogs : int  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ dist_Dogs  : int  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ indor_Dogs : int  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ daysin_Dogs: int  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ count_Othe : int  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ dist_Othe  : int  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ indor_Othe : int  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 $ daysin_Othe: int  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
 - attr(*, "reshapeWide")=List of 5
  ..$ v.names: chr [1:4] "count" "dist" "indor" "daysin"
  ..$ timevar: chr "anim"
  ..$ idvar  : chr "FSN"
  ..$ times  : chr [1:7] "Goat" "Poul" "Buff" "Cows" ...
  ..$ varying: chr [1:4, 1:7] "count_Goat" "dist_Goat" "indor_Goat" "daysin_Goat" ...
```
